SEARCH
Package gw.api.modules.rest.framework.v1.auth

Interface AuthorizedUser

public interface AuthorizedUser
Interface representing the user that has been authorized to use the REST API.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Attributes
    getAttributes()
    Attributes that can be associated with the authorized user, e.g. through properties on an access token.
    default String
    getLogDisplayName()
    Returns the PII safe display name of the authorized username.
    default List<String>
    getRoles()
    The roles of the authorized user.
    default RoleSets
    getRoleSets()
    The roles sets of the authorized user, if the user authenticated as a service with user context, there will be both token roles and user context roles.
    String
    getUsername()
    The user name of the authorized user.
    default String
    getUserType()
    The user type.
    boolean
    isInternal()
    Indicates whether or not the currently-authenticated user is an internal, named User in the system or an externally-authenticated User.

  • Method Details

    • isInternal

      boolean isInternal()
      Indicates whether or not the currently-authenticated user is an internal, named User in the system or an externally-authenticated User. If true, the CurrentUser thread-local is meaningful, if false the CurrentUser will be some sort of generic integration user.
      Returns:
      True if user is an internal, named User in the system

    • getAttributes

      Attributes getAttributes()
      Attributes that can be associated with the authorized user, e.g. through properties on an access token.
      Returns:
      The user attributes

    • getUsername

      String getUsername()
      The user name of the authorized user.
      Returns:
      the username of the authorized user

    • getRoles

      default List<String> getRoles()
      The roles of the authorized user. NOTE: If the the user authenticated as a service with user context, this method will throw an UnsupportedOperationException and getRoleSets() should be used instead
      Returns:
      the list of roles associated with the user

    • getRoleSets

      default RoleSets getRoleSets()
      The roles sets of the authorized user, if the user authenticated as a service with user context, there will be both token roles and user context roles. In all other circumstances there will just be token roles
      Returns:
      the roles sets associated with the user

    • getUserType

      default String getUserType()
      The user type.
      Returns:
      the user type of the authorized user

    • getLogDisplayName

      default String getLogDisplayName()
      Returns the PII safe display name of the authorized username. By default this will return the actual username,
      Returns:
      PII safe display name of the authorized username
